Refreshing but still substantial. A great warm weather beer with which to socialize.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Unassuming red that is refreshing with a clean mouthfeel. You still get a blast of hoppy goodness that belies its light aroma and slight head. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hoppiness Happiness. Stupendous IPA. feels well balanced despite being highly hoppy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

There's a lot going on in this pleasing mongrel beer, but it manages to be well-balanced and bright with a yummy aftertaste. It's part pale ale and wheat ale and yet this Frankenstein is a thing all its own. Good job, Six Row. I had this at their brewery in St. Louis. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice IPA that is hard to find locally in ST. Louis. Tried this one in the brilliant (though way too loud) Bailey's Range in downtown STL. It is hoppy goodness that still manages to be well-balanced although it pushes the envelope of hoppiness (at least for me).

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

1.5 finger off-white, full head sinks moderately quickly after pouring this deeply copper brew. The aroma is of fruit and hops and a hint of spiciness. Good taste with the fruit and hops getting top billing here, but not overpowering (in fact, maybe a little too muted?) Some peppery spice is blended well into the mix along with a sweet malt background, then finished dry. This beer is amply carbonated and finishes dry. I liked it. 8/9/13

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Faint aroma but a beauty to pour with deep golden murkiness. An impressive head that while dense-looking, dissipates too quickly with no lacing. While the aroma is underwhelming, the mouth feel is pleasant and the taste is nicely balanced. The hops are sounding on key and not overpowering everything like some other beer cacophonies out there. There's nice citrus, pine and honey there, all with nice blending and balance. This beer is modest and maybe a little bashful like the nerdy but cute girl in gym class. She's not gonna give you a night you'll never forget, but she's classy and consistentand she'll keep you warm at night after the hop-heads burn out their taste buds. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
